witnessInPerson.title: Witnessing in person, the event(s) as it occured to others

learningTraumaticEventsOccured.title: Learning that the traumatic event(s) occured to a person known

distressingMemoriesOfEvent.title: Intrusive distressing memories of the event

distressingDreams.title: Distressing dreams related to the traumatic event

dissociativeReactions.title: Dissociative reactions(eg flashbacks) that feel like event recurring

intenseProlongedDistress.title: Intense or prolonged distress at exposure to cues that symbolize or resemble event

markedPhysiologicalReactions.title: Marked physiological reactions at exposure to cues that symbolize or resemble event

effortsToAvoidMemories.title: Avoidance or efforts to avoid memories,thoughts or feelings associated with event

effortsToAvoidExternalReminders.title: Avoidance or efforts to avoid external reminders that cause distressing memories

inabilityToRemember.title: Inablity to remember an important aspect of the traumatic event

persistentNegaticeBeliefs.title: Persistent/exaggerated negative beliefs or expectations about oneself

persistentDistortedCognitions.title: Persistent distorted cognitions about cause or consequences of the event

diminishedInterestInActivities.title: Diminished interest or participation in significant activities

feelingsOfDetachment.title: Feelings of detachment or estrangement from others

patientIndicatedUnderstandingWRes.title: Patient indicated understanding with the following reservations:

lossOfApetiteAndOthers.title: Loss of appetite, difficulty sleeping, tics, upset stomach, headache, activation/anxiety, increased blood pressure/pulse, sudden cardiac death, psychosis, disinhibition, suicidal ideation, lowered seizure threshold

increasedSuicidalThoughts.title: Increased suicidal thoughts, mania, sexual side effects, upset stomach, diarrhea, nausea/vomiting, activation/anxiety, headache, insomnia

metabolicChanges.title: Metabolic changes including risk of hypertension, Diabetes mellitus, Hyperlipidemia, cardiac changes, weight gain

lowEnergyFatigue.title: Low energy, fatigue, or excessive sleepiness

negativeInteractionAlcohol.title: Negative interaction with alcohol and illicit drugs
